abstract: Discovery Communications, the owner of many cable channels, promoted what could be called a “Leno replacement package” at its presentation to advertisers last month.
snippet: Discovery Communications, the owner of many cable channels, promoted what could be called a “Leno replacement package” at its presentation to advertisers last month.
lead_paragraph: “Some major cable channels intend to crash the upfront week, scheduling presentations around those of their broadcast rivals,” Stuart Elliott and Bill Carter report in The New York Times on Monday. “For instance, ESPN, owned by Disney, will go on Tuesday. And cable channels owned by Time Warner, including TBS and TNT, will present on Wednesday.”

headline.main: Upfronts: Discovery Offers a ‘Leno Replacement Package’
